title: Fair and Balanced
body:
Normally, I'm not a big fan of getting on the forums and complaining about things, but today I came across something that actually irritated me quite a bit. I was playing Lucian, and was laning against a Tristana. I fire my ult, and she ults me, but hers cancels mine. Now, I'm sure anyone reading this knows, Lucian can move (and dash) during his ult, so why would being knocked back interrupt it? Furthermore, in a game earlier in the day, I stunned an opposing Lucian during his ult and it wasn't canceled. Makes very little sense to me that his ult would not be canceled by a stun, but would be canceled by a displacing ability. Lucian already has a hard enough time existing in the current meta, whereas Tristana is one of the more commonly used and potent adc's as it stands now. It's utterly absurd that one of his only good tools should be completely removed by a point and click ability that takes no skill to land.

/end rant

replies.body: ? how would a displacement not stop lucian, whose being forced to move and in certain way against his will.
He's able to move during his ult without canceling it, so why would someone moving him cancel it?
Yeah, it doesn't make any sense. I was playing a game on Ezreal the other day, and it canceled his ult during the windup. But if Singed throws him at the same moment, it doesn't cancel it.
